newsitem.title: CAMEROON: Central African central bank cuts interest rates.
newsitem.headline: Central African central bank cuts interest rates.

text.p: Official interest rates in the Cental African monetary zone were cut on Friday, the zone's central bank, the BEAC, said in a statement.
The intervention rate was cut by 0.25 percentage point to 7.50 percent from 7.75 percent and the two-to-seven-day lending rate was cut to 9.50 percent from 9.75 percent.
The central bank made no comment on the reduction.

The Central African monetary zone, part of the Franc Zone that links the CFA franc to the French franc, groups six countries -- Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Gabon, Chad and Equatorial Guinea.

Interest rates on bank deposits at the BEAC are unchanged, with the seven-day deposit rate at 3.00 percent, the 28-day deposit rate at 3-1/16 percent and the 84-day deposit rate at 3-1/8 percent, the statement added. -- Clare Black, Abidjan newsroom +225 21 90 90
